subject: Medicine
title: The Discovery of Penicillin
description: A quick, practical guide to The Discovery of Penicillin.

hook.text: Alexander Fleming left a petri dish uncovered before vacation. He returned to find mold killing bacteria.

buildup.text: The mold was Penicillium. It produced a substance that destroyed deadly staph bacteria on contact.

discovery.text: Fleming published his finding in 1929, but couldn't produce enough penicillin to treat a single patient.

twist.text: It took Florey and Chain a decade to mass-produce it. World War II accelerated the effort.

climax.text: Penicillin saved thousands of soldiers and launched the antibiotic era that transformed medicine.

punchline.text: A forgotten petri dish saved millions of lives.

quiz.question: Why was penicillin not immediately useful after Fleming's discovery?
options: It couldn't be produced in large enough quantities
It was too toxic for human use
Bacteria were already resistant to it
